snippet: With the exception of Germany, none of Europe’s biggest economies have returned to the level of economic output they had at the beginning of 2008.
abstract: News analysis; economists say the euro zone is hurtling back into recession, after official figures show a shrinking economy, by some measures under way for years; with the exception of Germany, none of Europe's biggest economies have returned to the level of output they had at the start of 2008; figures suggest Europe is well into what could become a lost decade--a period of stagnation and wasted potential that could have lasting effects on citizens.
lead_paragraph: With the exception of Germany, none of Europe’s biggest economies have returned to the level of economic output they had at the beginning of 2008.

headline.main: For Europe’s Economy, a Lost Decade Looms
headline.print_headline: For Europe’s Tepid Economy, a Lost Decade Looms
